quoteFirst: "It does not begin until five o'clock-five-thirty," said Montfanon, looking at his watch, "and it is now
quoteLast: .  Let us leave the catacomb, if you wish, and you can repeat your story to me up above.  A very great misfortune?  Well," he added, pressing the hand of the young man whom, personally, he liked as much as he detested his views, "rest assured, my dear child, we will prevent it!"
title: Cosmopolis — Volume 2

quoteFirst: His father,(494) who is dying, or dead, at Bath, and from whom he hopes two thousand a year, has sent for him.  He has refused to go--lest his steadiness should be questioned.  At
quoteLast: we divided.  Our cry was so loud, that both we and the ministers thought we had carried it.  It is not to be painted, the dismay of the latter--in good truth not without reason, for we were 197, they but 207.
title: The Letters of Horace Walpole, Earl of Orford — Volume 3
author: Walpole, Horace, 1717-1797

quoteFirst: We were informed by the guide-book that we were now 3,228 feet above the level of the lake--therefore full two-thirds of our journey had been accomplished. We got away at
quoteLast: ; a hundred yards above the hotel the railway divided; one track went straight up the steep hill, the other one turned square off to the right, with a very slight grade. We took the latter, and followed it more than a mile, turned a rocky corner, and came in sight of a handsome new hotel.
title: A Tramp Abroad — Volume 04
author: Twain, Mark, 1835-1910

quoteFirst: This settled, we returned to the legitimate roped quadrangle called “the ring” because it is _not_ round. Here, after positively refusing an arbitration which carries with its exercise nought but unpleasantness, a veteran Ring-goer (Old Tom Oliver), with the snows of sixty winters on his head, accepted the office. At
quoteLast: the men were escorted to the scratch. Orme was esquired by Jemmy Welsh and Jack Grant; Langham by D’Orsay Turner and Johnny Hannan. The men, at scale, were stated to be respectively 11st. 5lb. and 11st. 2lb.
